00018 #ifndef _CVBAND_H
00019 #define _CVBAND_H

00021 #ifdef __cplusplus  /* wrapper to enable C++ usage */

00025 #include <sundials/sundials_band.h>
00026 #include <sundials/sundials_nvector.h>
00027  
00028 /*
00029  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00030  * CVBAND solver constants
00031  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00032  * CVB_MSBJ : maximum number of steps between band Jacobian
00033  *            evaluations
00034  *
00035  * CVB_DGMAX : maximum change in gamma between band Jacobian
00036  *             evaluations
00037  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00038  */
00039 
00040 #define CVB_MSBJ  50
00041 #define CVB_DGMAX RCONST(0.2)
00042 
00043 /*
00044  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00045  * Type : CVBandJacFn
00046  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00047  * A band Jacobian approximation function Jac must have the
00048  * prototype given below. Its parameters are:
00049  *
00050  * N is the length of all vector arguments.
00051  *
00052  * mupper is the upper half-bandwidth of the approximate banded
00053  * Jacobian. This parameter is the same as the mupper parameter
00054  * passed by the user to the CVBand function.
00055  *
00056  * mlower is the lower half-bandwidth of the approximate banded
00057  * Jacobian. This parameter is the same as the mlower parameter
00058  * passed by the user to the CVBand function.
00059  *
00060  * J is the band matrix (of type BandMat) that will be loaded
00061  * by a CVBandJacFn with an approximation to the Jacobian matrix
00062  * J = (df_i/dy_j) at the point (t,y).
00063  * J is preset to zero, so only the nonzero elements need to be
00064  * loaded. Three efficient ways to load J are:
00065  *
00066  * (1) (with macros - no explicit data structure references)
00067  *    for (j=0; j < n; j++) {
00068  *       col_j = BAND_COL(J,j);
00069  *       for (i=j-mupper; i <= j+mlower; i++) {
00070  *         generate J_ij = the (i,j)th Jacobian element
00071  *         BAND_COL_ELEM(col_j,i,j) = J_ij;
00072  *       }
00073  *     }
00074  *
00075  * (2) (with BAND_COL macro, but without BAND_COL_ELEM macro)
00076  *    for (j=0; j < n; j++) {
00077  *       col_j = BAND_COL(J,j);
00078  *       for (k=-mupper; k <= mlower; k++) {
00079  *         generate J_ij = the (i,j)th Jacobian element, i=j+k
00080  *         col_j[k] = J_ij;
00081  *       }
00082  *     }
00083  *
00084  * (3) (without macros - explicit data structure references)
00085  *     offset = J->smu;
00086  *     for (j=0; j < n; j++) {
00087  *       col_j = ((J->data)[j])+offset;
00088  *       for (k=-mupper; k <= mlower; k++) {
00089  *         generate J_ij = the (i,j)th Jacobian element, i=j+k
00090  *         col_j[k] = J_ij;
00091  *       }
00092  *     }
00093  * Caution: J->smu is generally NOT the same as mupper.
00094  *
00095  * The BAND_ELEM(A,i,j) macro is appropriate for use in small
00096  * problems in which efficiency of access is NOT a major concern.
00097  *
00098  * t is the current value of the independent variable.
00099  *
00100  * y is the current value of the dependent variable vector,
00101  *      namely the predicted value of y(t).
00102  *
00103  * fy is the vector f(t,y).
00104  *
00105  * jac_data is a pointer to user data - the same as the jac_data
00106  *          parameter passed to CVBand.
00107  *
00108  * NOTE: If the user's Jacobian routine needs other quantities,
00109  *     they are accessible as follows: hcur (the current stepsize)
00110  *     and ewt (the error weight vector) are accessible through
00111  *     CVodeGetCurrentStep and CVodeGetErrWeights, respectively
00112  *     (see cvode.h). The unit roundoff is available as
00113  *     UNIT_ROUNDOFF defined in sundials_types.h
00114  *
00115  * tmp1, tmp2, and tmp3 are pointers to memory allocated for
00116  * vectors of length N which can be used by a CVBandJacFn
00117  * as temporary storage or work space.
00118  *
00119  * A CVBandJacFn should return 0 if successful, a positive value if 
00120  * a recoverable error occurred, and a negative value if an 
00121  * unrecoverable error occurred.
00122  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00123  */
00124 
00125 typedef int (*CVBandJacFn)(long int N, long int mupper, long int mlower,
00126                            BandMat J, realtype t,
00127                            N_Vector y, N_Vector fy, void *jac_data,
00128                            N_Vector tmp1, N_Vector tmp2, N_Vector tmp3);
00129 
00130 /*
00131  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00132  * Function : CVBand
00133  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00134  * A call to the CVBand function links the main CVODE integrator
00135  * with the CVBAND linear solver.
00136  *
00137  * cvode_mem is the pointer to the integrator memory returned by
00138  *           CVodeCreate.
00139  *
00140  * N is the size of the ODE system.
00141  *
00142  * mupper is the upper bandwidth of the band Jacobian
00143  *        approximation.
00144  *
00145  * mlower is the lower bandwidth of the band Jacobian
00146  *        approximation.
00147  *
00148  * The return value of CVBand is one of:
00149  *    CVBAND_SUCCESS   if successful
00150  *    CVBAND_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00151  *    CVBAND_MEM_FAIL  if there was a memory allocation failure
00152  *    CVBAND_ILL_INPUT if a required vector operation is missing or
00153  *                     if a bandwidth has an illegal value.
00154  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00155  */
00156 
00157 int CVBand(void *cvode_mem, long int N,
00158            long int mupper, long int mlower);
00159 
00160 /*
00161  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00162  * Optional inputs to the CVBAND linear solver
00163  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00164  *
00165  * CVBandSetJacFn specifies the band Jacobian approximation
00166  *                routine to be used. A user-supplied bjac routine
00167  *                must be of type CVBandJacFn. By default, a difference
00168  *                quotient routine CVBandDQJac, supplied with this
00169  *                solver is used.
00170  *                It also specifies a pointer to user data which is
00171  *                passed to the bjac routine every time it is called.
00172  *
00173  * The return value of CVBandSet* is one of:
00174  *    CVBAND_SUCCESS   if successful
00175  *    CVBAND_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00176  *    CVBAND_LMEM_NULL if the cvband memory was NULL
00177  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00178  */
00179 
00180 int CVBandSetJacFn(void *cvode_mem, CVBandJacFn bjac, void *jac_data);
00181 
00182 /*
00183  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00184  * Optional outputs from the CVBAND linear solver
00185  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00186  *
00187  * CVBandGetWorkSpace returns the real and integer workspace used
00188  *                    by CVBAND.
00189  * CVBandGetNumJacEvals returns the number of calls made to the
00190  *                      Jacobian evaluation routine bjac.
00191  * CVBandGetNumRhsEvals returns the number of calls to the user
00192  *                      f routine due to finite difference Jacobian
00193  *                      evaluation.
00194  * CVBandGetLastFlag returns the last error flag set by any of
00195  *                   the CVBAND interface functions.
00196  *
00197  * The return value of CVBandGet* is one of:
00198  *    CVBAND_SUCCESS   if successful
00199  *    CVBAND_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00200  *    CVBAND_LMEM_NULL if the cvband memory was NULL
00201  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00202  */
00203 
00204 int CVBandGetWorkSpace(void *cvode_mem, long int *lenrwLS, long int *leniwLS);
00205 int CVBandGetNumJacEvals(void *cvode_mem, long int *njevals);
00206 int CVBandGetNumRhsEvals(void *cvode_mem, long int *nfevalsLS);
00207 int CVBandGetLastFlag(void *cvode_mem, int *flag);
00208 
00209 /*
00210  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00211  * The following function returns the name of the constant 
00212  * associated with a CVBAND return flag
00213  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00214  */
00215 
00216 char *CVBandGetReturnFlagName(int flag);
00217 
00218 /* CVBAND return values */
00219 
00220 #define CVBAND_SUCCESS           0
00221 #define CVBAND_MEM_NULL         -1
00222 #define CVBAND_LMEM_NULL        -2
00223 #define CVBAND_ILL_INPUT        -3
00224 #define CVBAND_MEM_FAIL         -4
00225 
00226 /* Additional last_flag values */
00227 
00228 #define CVBAND_JACFUNC_UNRECVR  -5
00229 #define CVBAND_JACFUNC_RECVR    -6

00231 #ifdef __cplusplus
00232 }
